newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak shares close lower in quiet trading on BSE.
newsitem.headline: Slovak shares close lower in quiet trading on BSE.

text.p: Major Slovak shares closed mixed in quiet trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE) on Tuesday, with losses to the average prices of steel maker VSZ and oil and gas storage Nafta dragging the SAX index down.
Both VSZ and Nafta closed up on the day, but their average prices, on which the SAX is calculated, were down by 8.57 and 3.99 percent respectively to pull the index down 4.4 points to 181.02.
Brokers said prices are slowly nearing a level where investor interest may once again be piqued.

"We expected a fall in VSZ's average price, as it had been artificially boosted by settlements of older deals," said Libor Briska of Creditanstalt. "Issues are soon to be cheap, if this development continues."
Overall volume increased to 625,007 shares, from 220,929 shares traded on Monday, while turnover rose to 245.02 million crowns, from 198.60 million.
